data.message: Ehhhh idk man good to hear some new Em the first lil bit was promising , but then went back to the "teeter tatteer stretch for a punch" flow just spit and quit trying to impress folks too much lol

replies.message: I guess you would prefer him stop trying to impress and just throw some sh*t over a beat with mumbled words and a nice hook ? Maybe even talk about money and hoes ? But then that would be trying to impress ... Dude probably doesn't even give a fuck and is repping with another Detroit rapper for fun. That never crosses anybody's mind though.

Yeah I get it. Ditch the choppyness for regular rapping. Hearing his newest stuff I'd agree, but this feature on this song he switches it up enough that it just sounds great. I like, have to listen to this song twice a day. Instead of monotone chopping, he changes tone and flow and the beat compliments the shady side. Starts off with a lower voice that I've had a few friends say they didn't even know it was em. Then throughout he keeps raising pitch until the climax (like a movie) until the trump line. Whole thing gave me shivers the first handful of times.
